formattedAddress: 447 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 447 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

editorialSummary.text: Hot spot serving New American fare, including vegetarian-friendly choices, and creative cocktails.

originalText.text:
Had brunch with my friends here, and it was amazing. Definitely a crowded and bustling vibe but not in a bad way. Food came relatively quickly and our waiter was extremely attentive. Strongly recommend having a reservation or calling ahead.

Do yourself a favor and order the duck hash for brunch and the GF pancakes

Do yourself a favor and order the duck hash for brunch and the GF pancakes

originalText.text: Brunch in the garden was perfect particularly with the Prosecco. Duck salad and cheesecake were done so well, I’d go back just for those 2 dishes.

text.text: Brunch in the garden was perfect particularly with the Prosecco. Duck salad and cheesecake were done so well, I’d go back just for those 2 dishes.

originalText.text:
We have been regulars for about 3 years now and Hudson Clearwater is our favorite brunch spot, hands down.  It has all the qualities one looks for in a dining experience.  Great service, great food & drinks, in a great atmosphere.  We have loved the experience from day one! Our consistent satisfaction with everything has made it our favorite.

If you’re looking for a regular brunch spot—you will not be disappointed!  We experience all the perks from being regulars.  The servers always stop by for a quick hello even if they’re not the ones waiting your table… we even had the owner stop by our table to say thank you for our repeated business (he may have noticed our many visits from the reservation system).  It’s so nice to be remembered and what a way to feel welcome!! One of the servers knows that I always order the crusted french toast for “dessert” and she also knows how I like it— piping hot and with an extra maple syrup—so even when she is not the server for our table… she hand-delivers my french toast ensuring thst it is piping hot and with all the accoutrements.  Above and beyond!!  This makes my day!

Our personal faves: artichoke hearts, fries, hudson scramble, herbed french omelette, cornflake crusted french toast, cinnamon bun, or key lime pie.

The all natural interior with the sunlight peeking in through the big bright windows— and the outside garden area available for dining—give it a nice warm country feel.  It has character and charm.  We hope this gem is around for our brunch dates for many more years to come!

originalText.text:
You be the judge.

Reservation at 9am - seated immediately as the restaurant was empty, waiter took our drink order

9:30am - drinks finally comes, waiter takes our food order, restaurant is 40% full.

9:45am - our appetizer comes (the cinnamon roll).

10:30am - food finally comes, 3 dishes were cold and soggy, other 2 was warm.

10:45am - walked up to the bar because nobody would bring the check to us to pay the $200 for cold soggy food that showed up 90mins after we were seated.

I want to clarify that the kitchen is working HARD. I watched food sit at the pass for over 30 minutes and not getting served to tables (see picture). Funny part is that they have more than 10 people working here, so for sure not short staffed at all.

This seems to be an ongoing problem. Previous reviews have mentioned how slow service was. Sad part was food was actually not bad. Service is something that really needs to be fixed.

originalText.text: went there for brunch for second time in 2 weeks.  restaurant is small and crowded but the environment is warm and inviting.  Service was very good, as was the food.  no pressure to leave our table of 4 even though the restaurant was packed.  I look forward to returning for dinner, especially in the spring to enjoy the outdoor patio dining.
